problem_text: Figure 23-51 shows a cross section through a very large nonconducting slab of thickness $d=9.40 \mathrm{~mm}$ and uniform volume charge density $\rho=5.80$ $\mathrm{fC} / \mathrm{m}^3$. The origin of an $x$ axis is at the slab's center. What is the magnitude of the slab's electric field at an $x$ coordinate of 0?
